info.description: Role based access control provides you a way to apply granular level policy administration down to individual resources or resource groups. These operations enable you to manage role definitions and role assignments. A role definition describes the set of actions that can be performed on resources. A role assignment grants access to Azure Active Directory users.
info.title: AuthorizationManagementClient

ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.
ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version

ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group.
ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName

ResourceProviderNamespaceParameter.description: The namespace of the resource provider.
ResourceProviderNamespaceParameter.name: resourceProviderNamespace

SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.
SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId

get.description: Gets provider operations metadata for all resource providers.

parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand the values.
parameters.name: $expand

200.description: OK - Returns an array of the operations metadata.

get.description: Gets provider operations metadata for the specified resource provider.

parameters.description: Specifies whether to expand the values.
parameters.name: $expand

get.description: Gets all role assignments for the subscription.

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. Use $filter=atScope() to return all role assignments at or above the scope. Use $filter=principalId eq {id} to return all role assignments at, above or below the scope for the specified principal.
parameters.name: $filter

200.description: OK - Returns an array of role assignments.

get.description: Gets role assignments for a resource group.

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. Use $filter=atScope() to return all role assignments at or above the scope. Use $filter=principalId eq {id} to return all role assignments at, above or below the scope for the specified principal.
parameters.name: $filter

200.description: OK - Returns an array of role assignments.

get.description: Gets all permissions the caller has for a resource group.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of permissions.

get.description: Gets all permissions the caller has for a resource.

parameters.description: The parent resource identity.
parameters.name: parentResourcePath

parameters.description: The resource type of the resource.
parameters.name: resourceType

parameters.description: The name of the resource to get the permissions for.
parameters.name: resourceName

200.description: OK - Returns an array of permissions.

parameters.name: parentResourcePath

parameters.description: The name of the resource to get role assignments for.

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. Use $filter=atScope() to return all role assignments at or above the scope. Use $filter=principalId eq {id} to return all role assignments at, above or below the scope for the specified principal.
parameters.name: $filter

200.description: OK - Returns an array of role assignments.

parameters.description: The ID of the role assignment to delete.
parameters.name: roleId

200.description: OK - Returns information about the role assignment.

get.description: Gets role assignments for a scope.

parameters.description: The scope of the role assignments.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. Use $filter=atScope() to return all role assignments at or above the scope. Use $filter=principalId eq {id} to return all role assignments at, above or below the scope for the specified principal.
parameters.name: $filter

200.description: OK - Returns an array of role assignments.

parameters.description: The scope of the role assignment to delete.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The name of the role assignment to delete.
parameters.name: roleAssignmentName

200.description: OK - Returns information about the role assignment.

parameters.description: The scope of the role assignment.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The name of the role assignment to get.
parameters.name: roleAssignmentName

200.description: OK - Returns information about the role assignment.

parameters.description: The scope of the role assignment to create. The scope can be any REST resource instance. For example, use '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/' for a subscription, '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}' for a resource group, and '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}' for a resource.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The name of the role assignment to create. It can be any valid GUID.
parameters.name: roleAssignmentName

parameters.description: Parameters for the role assignment.
parameters.name: parameters

201.description: Created - Returns information about the role assignment.

get.description: Get all role definitions that are applicable at scope and above.

parameters.description: The scope of the role definition.

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. Use atScopeAndBelow filter to search below the given scope as well.

parameters.name: roleDefinition

201.description: OK - Returns information about the role definition.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

isDataAction.description: The dataAction flag to specify the operation type.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

canDelegate.description: The Delegation flag for the roleassignment

principalId.description: Returns role assignment of the specific principal.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

canDelegate.description: The delgation flag used for creating a role assignment

principalId.description: The principal ID assigned to the role. This maps to the ID inside the Active Directory. It can point to a user, service principal, or security group.

roleDefinitionId.description: The role definition ID used in the role assignment.

canDelegate.description: The Delegation flag for the roleassignment

roleName.description: Returns role definition with the specific name.

type.description: Returns role definition with the specific type.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

get.description: Gets a role definition by ID.

parameters.description: The fully qualified role definition ID. Use the format, /subscriptions/{guid}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/{roleDefinitionId} for subscription level role definitions, or /providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/{roleDefinitionId} for tenant level role definitions.
parameters.name: roleId

200.description: OK - Returns information about the role definition.
